wikipedia_page.main: Katy Daley-McLean  (born 19 December 1985) is an English rugby union player, who was captain of England Women and captained them to victory against Canada in the 2014 France Rugby World Cup. She plays rugby union at fly-half for Loughborough Lightning in Premier 15s. She received an MBE in the 2014 New Year Honours.  Katy graduated from the University of Sunderland with a BSc in Sports Studies in 2007. She works professionally as a schoolteacher.McLean was named in the squad for the 2017 Women's Rugby World Cup in Ireland.In December 2020, she retired from playing Rugby Union on an international basis.

response: Ceri Large (born 1990) is a female rugby union player.  She made her international debut in 2011 against . She represented  at the 2014 Women's Rugby World Cup. Large played in every pool game because of her impressive performance, but was replaced in the semi-finals by team captain Katy McLean.
